meanings.definition: To sulk more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She was outsulking her friend after they had an argument.
meanings.sent2: He always ends up outsulking everyone when things don't go his way.
meanings.sent3: The little girl was outsulking her brother over who got the bigger cookie.
meanings.sent4: His dark cloud of outsulking overshadowed the cheerful mood of the party.
meanings.sent5: The image of her outsulking face stuck in his mind for days.

meanings.definition: The act of sulking more than others.
meanings.sent1: His constant outsulking made the atmosphere tense.
meanings.sent2: The outsulking in the room was palpable after the disappointing news.
meanings.sent3: The outsulking of the child was quickly forgotten once the ice cream arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her outsulking was like a dark cloud hanging over the family gathering.
meanings.sent5: The outsulking of the cat when it didn't get its favorite treat was quite amusing.

meanings.definition: Someone who sulks more than others.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the outsulking queen among her friends.
meanings.sent2: The outsulking in the group was getting on everyone's nerves.
meanings.sent3: The outsulking of the child was met with eye rolls from the adults.
meanings.sent4: He became an expert in outsulking after years of practice.
meanings.sent5: The outsulking of the student was a clear sign of his frustration.
